structured.description: A function `f` that takes a single argument `x` and returns it unchanged.

items.description: Takes a single argument `x` and returns it unchanged.

params.name: x
params.description: Used to represent an input value that gets returned unchanged after being processed through the function's logic.

returns.description: Xthe input value passed to it.

usage.code: let x = f(5); // The function f() takes an integer as its argument and returns it.

items.name: f

structured.description: A function `wip()` that does nothing. The function has no arguments and does not return any value. It simply passes without performing any action.

items.description: Has no functionality as it only contains a comment "# some day" and does not contain any actual code to execute.

usage.code: wip(["apple", "banana", "orange"]) # returns a list of unique items in the input list

items.name: wip
